repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
- Format `rules.bzl`
- Use `cc_binary` instead of `cytonize.py` to compile generated CC code
- Use rules libraries instead of deprecated native ones

comment_data.body: Maybe call this cc_deps to be clear?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,52 +19,87 @@ The __init__.py file must be in your srcs list so that Cython can resolve
 cimports using the package layout.
 """
 
+load("@rules_cc//cc:defs.bzl", "cc_binary")
+load("@rules_python//python:defs.bzl", "py_library")
+
 def pyx_library(
         name,
-        deps=[],
-        srcs=[],
-        cython_directives=[],
-        cython_options=[],
+        deps = [],

comment_data.body: Also, where would .pxd files that are needed go? pxd_deps?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,52 +19,87 @@ The __init__.py file must be in your srcs list so that Cython can resolve
 cimports using the package layout.
 """
 
+load("@rules_cc//cc:defs.bzl", "cc_binary")
+load("@rules_python//python:defs.bzl", "py_library")
+
 def pyx_library(
         name,
-        deps=[],
-        srcs=[],
-        cython_directives=[],
-        cython_options=[],
+        deps = [],

comment_data.body:
> Maybe call this `cc_deps` to be clear?

There is a tradeoff between clarity and backwards compatibility.
So keeping the `deps` name would maintain backwards compatibility making the upgrade mostly a drop-in replacement. Renaming it to `cc_deps` would be a more breaking change. Please let me know which one you prefer.

> Also, where would .pxd files that are needed go? pxd_deps?

IIUC `.pxd` files should just be added via `srcs` (see docstring).

@@ -19,52 +19,87 @@ The __init__.py file must be in your srcs list so that Cython can resolve
 cimports using the package layout.
 """
 
+load("@rules_cc//cc:defs.bzl", "cc_binary")
+load("@rules_python//python:defs.bzl", "py_library")
+

         name,
-        deps=[],
-        srcs=[],
-        cython_directives=[],
-        cython_options=[],
+        deps = [],

comment_data.body:
What would be best is if deps could be a mix of things as we could automatically sort them out, but I guess that's not very easy...

We could make it an alias for backwards compatibility. 

In the meantime, this is definitely an improvement.

comment_data.body: These were arguments to the cythonize tool which is no longer used. What would you expect these parameters to do in the current implementation?

commit.message: Use cc_binary instead of cytonize.py to compile generated CC code
Use rules libraries instead of deprecated native ones

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

title: Improve Bazel `pyx_library()`
